recipes.label: An Understanding in Blood
recipes.startdescription: Today I have defeated an enemy of inhuman quality - what some might call 'a monster.' The Lionsmith shapes monsters, and through battle, through the rigor of the field, I have learned a little of his craft.

recipes.label: An Ancient Industry
recipes.startdescription: When he walked the world in flesh, the Lionsmith came to the Ligeian Echidna as a pupil, and learned from her the secrets for the generation of monsters - secrets set down at the dawn of the world by the Seven Coils and her Names. Echidna was the hungriest of those Names, and even now she lusts after the creations of her once-student...
recipes.description: The Serpent, the Key-Bearer, the General. All of them have taken part in a monstrous industry. Now I share in that industry; in the manufacture of monsters; in a legacy of terrors.

recipes.label: A Golden Industry
recipes.startdescription: The Lionsmith makes monsters to defeat the Tribune, and all his designs are geared towards the waging of war. In his warriors he sets strength, courage, and honour; he sets in them rules, too: be wary of hunger, of temptation, of each other...
recipes.description: We might conclude that the Lionsmith loves his children - but only as one loves weapons. When true to their designs, they must be cherished; when they are broken, they must reforged; when they cannot be reforged, they must be cast aside.
